title: Earthquake shakes down price-costco sales figures
author: Seattle Times Staffseattle Times News Services
text: KIRKLAND - The Jan. 17 Southern California earthquake and severe weather in the Northeast contributed to a 1 percent decline in four-week comparable-store sales at Price/Costco, the membership-warehouse discount chain said. The data compares sales of stores open at least a year     Sales of all stores in the four weeks ended Feb. 13 rose 8 percent, to $1.13 billion from $1.05 billion.     Second-quarter sales rose 7 percent, to $4.01 billion from $3.74 billion. Comparable store sales fell 1 percent. Midyear sales rose 6 percent, to $7.6 billion from $7.2 billion, but comparable store sales fell 3 percent.
